Name: Brain Correlates of Deductive Reasoning in Adults
ReferencesAndLinks: Prado J, Mutreja R, & Booth JR (2012). Fractionating the Neural Substrates of Transitive REasoning: Task-Dependent Contributions of Spatial and Verbal Representations. Cerebral Cortex, 23, 499-507.
HowToAcknowledge:
Please cite this dataset as well as the corresponding data descriptor for use of this dataset:

Lytle MN, Prado J & Booth JR (2020). Brain correlates of deductive reasoning in adults. OpenNeuro. 10.18112/openneuro.ds003076

Lytle MN , Prado J & Booth JR (2020). A neuroimaging dataset of deductive reasoning in school-aged children. Data in Brief, 33, 106405.
